title: Factors Associated With Pathogenicity of Anti-Glomerular Basal Membrane Antibodies
patient: A 48-year-old man consulted the emergency department for acute renal failure. He reported a medical history of hypertension, heavy smoking, obesity with body mass index 40 kg/m2, sleep apnea, multiple venous thromboses, and a pulmonary embolism 7 years ago treated by a vitamin K antagonist (fluindione). He had normal creatininemia values until 2 months before referral.
